thread.title: Young mum found hanged in her flat sent chilling message to boyfriend after pair’s row about parking escalated
thread.title_full: Young mum found hanged in her flat sent chilling message to boyfriend after pair’s row about parking escalated

author: lburnip
title: Young mum found hanged in her flat sent chilling message to boyfriend after pair’s row about parking escalated
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A YOUNG mum who told her boyfriend she would harm herself if they split up was found hanged after texting him “I’ve done it, thanks”. 
Businessman Martin Westwell said Lyndsey Higgins, 30, cut herself and used self harm to “control” their volatile relationship. Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd Lyndsey Higgins was found hanged at home in Barnoldswick, Lancs., after a “silly” row with her partner Martin Westwell Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd Lyndsey, who managed a gym owned by Martin, had been discharged from hospital after a sleeping pill overdose hours before her death Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd 5 The 30-year-old mum of one had a “volatile” relationship with the former fireman, her inquest heard 
The former fireman found her dead at her apartment in Barnoldswick, Lancs., after she didn’t reply to his “done what?” message. 
An inquest heard Lyndsey, who managed a gym owned by Mr Westwell, had been discharged from hospital after an overdose of sleeping tablets just hours before her death. 
Mr Westwell said she even told doctors she would try to kill herself again and asked for more tablets, but was allowed to discharge herself. 
When she became “aggressive and threatening” on the way home, Mr Westwell said he stopped the car and she got out “laughing”. 
An inquest into Ms Higgins death on December 18 2015 heard the couple rowed earlier that night over what Mr Westwell said was “silliness”. 
The hearing in Burnley was told Miss Higgins, originally from Liverpool, had hoped to study midwifery and had won a place at Chester University. 
She had initially moved in with Mr Westwell, 44, but later found a flat nearby where she would stay following arguments. RELATED STORIES 'SHE WASN'T COPING' Young mum, 28, found hanged 'after suffering from visions her baby had been thrown out of a window' STUDENT TRAGEDY Son of millionaire New York doctor found hanged in his lodgings at Oxford where he was studying DEATH PLUNGE TRAGEDY Neuroscience student, 23, found dead in gorge in 'fourth suicide' from same university since September ‘My sick stepbrother abused me’ Brave woman reveals how nine years of sexual assaults from the age of SIX scarred her childhood – and drove her to attempt suicide at 16 DEATH ON CAMERA Aspiring actor streams his suicide on Facebook Live from his car days after he is arrested for sexual assault 
In a statement, Mr Westwell told the inquest: ”’Lyndsey had confided in me that she had previously self harmed, and she found it to be a release to her.”She had cut herself on her arms before, and she told me that she did love me, but sometimes she felt like she wanted to do it.“That made her feel bad about herself so she cut herself again. 
“I felt that she used her self harm to control me and the relationship, saying that if we did split up she would cause harm to herself.” 
“We did begin to argue and the relationship was difficult, arguing about things like the TV was too loud.“On the night before she died we decided to go out to the cinema and she had dropped off her son with her parents.”I drove and we struggled to find somewhere to park except for a disabled space, and Lyndsey got annoyed about that. Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd Mr Westwell met Miss Higgins online in 2014 after she split from the father of her young son Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd 5 The pair initially lived together but Lyndsey moved into a nearby flat where she stayed after rows 
“I said to her we won’t have any of this silliness tonight and she got upset saying I was calling her silly.“I said I wasn’t, but I didn’t want to eat anymore so we went back to my house. 
After the row, he and Lyndsey had text each other to apologise, and she asked him to come round the next morning. 
But when he arrived he found her on the sofa cuddling a picture of her son after taking sleeping tablets. 
He took her to hospital and stayed with her until she came round, when she began shouting that she wanted to go home. 
“I got a text from her saying: ”I’ve done it, thanks.” I replied with ‘done what?’ but she didn’t text me after that so I called 999.” 
Mr Westwell – who met Ms Higgins on a dating sate in January 2014 – said he went to her flat but found her dead. 
He added: “Lyndsey was beautiful and I greatly regret not being able to get her the help she needed.” 
Miss Higgins’ mother Pam, 64, told the inquest Lyndsey was the “life and soul of the party” and turned her life around after suffering depression. 
”I would describe her and Martin’s relationship as volatile. It went from one extreme to the other, we tried to get her to come back, and say look this isn’t working out how you wanted. 
“She had a place to go, her bedroom was ready and waiting and we had a nursery place for her son sorted. 
“Lyndsey had everything to live for. My main concern is why the hospital didn’t try to contact us at all? 
“She had written the contact details down so why didn’t they contact us?” 
The inquest continues. 
Do you need help? Contact The Samaritans on 116 123 or visit www.samaritans.org . PAPYRUS HOPELineUK also provides confidential suicide prevention advice and support to young people and others worried about them tel 0800 068 4141 text 07786 209 697 email
